page.title: 16Himley Hall (1)
page.content: { Himley Hall}was{built}in{1740}by{John {Sixth Baron Ward,}when the{Ward family moved from{Sedgley}because of more {factories}in the{middle}of the{19th {century}the{family}moved to{Witley {Court. In{1919 William Hunble, the Earl of {Dudley,}took the{family}back to {Himley.In 1947 Himley Hall}was sold to the{National Coal Board,}and it remained in{use}as{offices until 1968, when it was{resold}to{Dudley}and {Wolverhampton Metropolitian Borough. {Wolverhampton}use the{main part}of the house.For part of their{Polytechnic {site.Dudley}used the{laundry block}as a{teachers' centre}until{July 1984 when this was{moved}to another place. {Parts}of the{grounds}have been{opened to the{public since 1968}and{Dudley {M.B.}have been in charge of these.
